page.title: 11FISHING West Forres
page.content: A part of the River Findhorn is leased by Moray District Council to Forres ANgling Association.Permits may be bought to fish with rod and line for salmon and sea trout from 11th February to 6th October from Red CRaig to Findhorn Bay.There are several favourite pools on this stretch: Red Craig,Cothall Shot,Limekilns Pool,St John's Pool,New Pool and AShen Tree Pool.The Findhorn is a spring river and the fish travel up the river in spring.On one night in 1780 one thousand fish were caught by net in the SLUIE POOL.Fishing by net is no longer permitted.Since 1900 however numbers have declined perhaps because more fish are caught at sea.Another reason is that every year organised gangs from further south use explosives and poison to poach salmon,killing everything for a mile.
